text: |} The Corrib Fillies Stakes is a Listed flat horse race in Ireland open to mares and fillies aged three years or older. It is run at Galway over a distance of 7 furlongs (1,408 metres), and it is scheduled to take place each year at the Galway Festival in late July or early August. The race was first run in 2012. ==Records== Most successful horse: * no horse has won this race more than once Leading jockey (2 wins): * Declan McDonogh – Laviniad (2015), Planchart (2016) Leading trainer (2 wins): *Johnny Murtagh – Dalkova (2014), Champers Elysees (2020) ==Winners== {| class = "sortable" | border="1" style="border-collapse: collapse; font-size:90%" |- bgcolor="#77dd77" align="center" ! style="width:36px" | Year ! style="width:160px" | Winner ! style="width:30px" | Age ! style="width:180px" | Jockey ! style="width:180px" | Trainer ! style="width:60px" | Time |- | 2012 | Lady Wingshot | 3 | Kevin Manning | Jim Bolger | 1:28.55 |- | 2013 | Yellow Rosebud | 4 | Pat Smullen | Dermot Weld | 1:31.40 |- | 2014 | Dalkova | 5 | Niall McCullagh | Johnny Murtagh | 1:27.01 |- | 2015 | Laviniad | 5 | Declan McDonogh | Willie Mullins | 1:27.71 |- | 2016 | Planchart | 3 | Declan McDonogh | Andrew Slattery | 1:28.76 |- | 2017 | Music Box | 3 | Donnacha O'Brien | Aidan O'Brien | 1:31.10 |- | 2018 | Yulong Gold Fairy | 3 | Shane Foley | Dermot Weld | 1:28.77 |- | 2019 | Surrounding | 6 | Ronan Whelan | Michael Halford | 1:27.42 |- | 2020 | Champers Elysees | 3 | Ben Coen | Johnny Murtagh | 1:27.67 |} ==See also== * Horse racing in Ireland * List of Irish flat horse races ==References== *Racing Post: **, , , , , , , , Category:Flat races in Ireland Category:Mile category horse races for fillies and mares Category:Ballybrit Racecourse Category:2012 establishments in Ireland Category:Recurring sporting events established in 2012
